CardDetails.description: Serializer for the CardDetails nested object.

external_ids.description: JSON string of external IDs (portable across DBs)

print_run.description: Optional print run or edition info.

ChangePassword.description:
Serializer for password change.

Requires current password verification before allowing password change.
Validates new password against Django's password validators.

CheckEmailExists.description:
Serializer to check if an email is already registered.

Used for client-side validation during registration.

Collectible.description: Serializer for the Collectible model with nested card details support.

category.description: High-level category (e.g., TCG, Video Games, Collectibles).

image_url.description: Public image URL stored in Supabase.

intake_price.description: The price paid for the item (cost basis).

name.description: The common name of the collectible item.

price.description: The current market value or selling price.

projected_price.description: The projected price based on market trends.

quantity.description: Current number of units in stock.

user.description: The user/vendor who owns this inventory item.

CompleteProfile.description: Serializer used during onboarding to capture the rest of the user's profile details.

CurrentUser.description:
Serializer for the current authenticated user.

This combines User model fields with the nested UserProfile data.
Uses nested serialization to include profile data in the response.

company_code.description: Optional invite code to link this user to an existing company.

company_name.description: Display name for the vendor or company.

phone_number.description: Contact phone number in E.164 format.

profile_completed.description: Indicates whether the user has finished the onboarding form.

role.description:
Controls the user's permissions within a company.

* `admin` - Administrator
* `vendor_manager` - Vendor Manager
* `staff` - Staff
* `solo` - Solo
* `viewer` - Viewer

tos_accepted_at.description: Timestamp when the user accepted terms of service.

username.description: Required. 150 characters or fewer. Letters, digits and @/./+/-/_ only.

InventoryMedia.description: Serializer for media associated with collectibles.

height.description: Height of the media in pixels (if applicable).

is_primary.description: Whether this media is the primary display image.

media_type.description:
Classify this media (primary vs gallery).

* `primary` - Primary Image
* `gallery` - Gallery Image

size_kb.description: Size of the media file in kilobytes.

sort_order.description: Order of media files for display purposes.

url.description: Public URL of the media file.

width.description: Width of the media in pixels (if applicable).

Logout.description:
Serializer for logout (token blacklisting).

Accepts a refresh token and blacklists it to prevent further use.

PasswordResetConfirm.description:
Serializer for confirming password reset with token.

Verifies the token and sets the new password.

PasswordResetRequest.description:
Serializer for requesting a password reset.

Sends an email with reset link if the email exists.
Always succeeds to prevent email enumeration.

email.description: Email address associated with your account

PatchedCollectible.description: Serializer for the Collectible model with nested card details support.

category.description: High-level category (e.g., TCG, Video Games, Collectibles).

image_url.description: Public image URL stored in Supabase.

intake_price.description: The price paid for the item (cost basis).

name.description: The common name of the collectible item.

price.description: The current market value or selling price.

projected_price.description: The projected price based on market trends.

quantity.description: Current number of units in stock.

user.description: The user/vendor who owns this inventory item.

PatchedUpdateProfile.description:
Serializer for updating user profile via PUT/PATCH.

Handles all profile fields including:
- User fields: username, email
- Profile fields: phone, bio, profile_picture, vendor

Supports multipart/form-data for file uploads.

company_code.description: Invite code tying this user to a company.

company_name.description: Company/vendor name displayed in the app.

vendor_id.description: ID of vendor to associate with (null to clear)

company_code.description: Optional invite code to join an existing company.

company_name.description: Optional vendor/company name shown in the app.

RoleEnum.description:
* `admin` - Administrator
* `vendor_manager` - Vendor Manager
* `staff` - Staff
* `solo` - Solo
* `viewer` - Viewer

UpdateProfile.description:
Serializer for updating user profile via PUT/PATCH.

Handles all profile fields including:
- User fields: username, email
- Profile fields: phone, bio, profile_picture, vendor

Supports multipart/form-data for file uploads.

company_code.description: Invite code tying this user to a company.

company_name.description: Company/vendor name displayed in the app.

vendor_id.description: ID of vendor to associate with (null to clear)

UserMedia.description: Serializer for user media payloads (avatars, banners, logos).

UserMediaMediaTypeEnum.description:
* `profile_avatar` - Profile Avatar
* `vendor_logo` - Vendor Logo
* `storefront_banner` - Storefront Banner
* `user_banner` - User Banner

UserProfile.description:
Serializer for UserProfile model.

This handles the profile-specific fields like bio, phone, and profile_picture.
The profile_picture field is automatically converted to a full URL by DRF.

profile_picture.description: User's profile picture URL (stored in Supabase)

post.description:
POST /api/v1/auth/logout/

Logout by blacklisting the refresh token.

- Requires authentication (JWT token)
- Blacklists the provided refresh token
- After logout, the refresh token can no longer be used to get new access tokens

Request body:
    {
        "refresh": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJI..."
    }

Response:
    {"detail": "Successfully logged out."}

get.description:
GET /api/v1/auth/me/
PUT/PATCH /api/v1/auth/me/

Returns and updates the currently authenticated user's data including their profile.

- Requires authentication (JWT token)
- Uses selector pattern to optimize database queries
- Returns nested profile data with full profile_picture URL
- Supports file uploads for profile_picture (multipart/form-data)

To upload a profile picture:
- Send PUT or PATCH request with multipart/form-data
- Include 'profile_picture' field with image file
- Supported formats: JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP
- Max size: 5MB

Response:
    {
        "id": 1,
        "username": "melissa",
        "email": "melissa@example.com",
        "profile": {
            "id": 1,
            "phone": "555-1234",
            "bio": "Django developer",
            "profile_picture": "http://localhost:8000/media/profile_pictures/melissa.jpg",
            "created_at": "2025-11-29T10:00:00Z",
            "updated_at": "2025-11-29T10:00:00Z"
        }
    }

patch.description:
GET /api/v1/auth/me/
PUT/PATCH /api/v1/auth/me/

Returns and updates the currently authenticated user's data including their profile.

- Requires authentication (JWT token)
- Uses selector pattern to optimize database queries

To upload a profile picture:

post.description:
POST /api/v1/auth/password/change/

Change password for the authenticated user.

Requires:
- Authentication (JWT token)
- Current password for verification
- New password (min 8 characters, validated against Django password validators)

Request body:
    {
        "old_password": "current_password",
        "new_password": "new_secure_password"
    }

Response:
    {"detail": "Password changed successfully."}

POST /api/v1/auth/password/reset/

Request a password reset email.

- Public endpoint (no authentication required)
- Rate limited to 1 request per 5 minutes per user
- Always returns success to prevent email enumeration

Request body:
    {
        "email": "user@example.com"
    }

Response:
    {"detail": "If an account with that email exists, a password reset link has been sent."}

POST /api/v1/auth/password/reset/confirm/

Confirm password reset with token and set new password.

- Public endpoint (no authentication required)
- Requires valid reset token from email
- Token expires after 24 hours

Request body:
    {
        "uid": 1,
        "token": "abc123...",
        "new_password": "new_secure_password"
    }

Response:
    {"detail": "Password has been reset successfully."}
Authenticated endpoint for completing the onboarding profile form.
Public endpoint for registering a new user account.

POST /api/v1/auth/register/check-email/

Check if an email is already registered.

- Public endpoint (no authentication required)

Request body:
    {
        "email": "user@example.com"
    }

Takes a set of user credentials and returns an access and refresh JSON web
token pair to prove the authentication of those credentials.

Takes a refresh type JSON web token and returns an access type JSON web
token if the refresh token is valid.

Takes a token and indicates if it is valid.  This view provides no
information about a token's fitness for a particular use.
